text: Mattie William Pollock (born 28 September 2001) is an English professional footballer who plays as a defender for EFL League Two side Grimsby Town. ==Career== Pollock attended the Nunthorpe Academy and was attached to Leeds United up until under-15 level, where he was considered a midfielder. He joined Grimsby Town on a scholarship in 2018 after being scouted playing as a defender for his father's team, Polton Allstars. He was called up to the first-team bench by manager Michael Jolley for the first time in October 2018. He was given his professional debut on 29 December, coming on as a 52nd-minute substitute for Martyn Woolford in a 2–1 win at Exeter City following a red card for centre-back Alex Whitmore. He turned professional in February 2019 and upon signing a -year deal said that "my ultimate ambition is to be the best central defender in the world and play at the highest level I can". He was given his first start for the "Mariners" on 13 August 2019, in a 1–0 victory over Doncaster Rovers at Blundell Park. ==Personal life== He is the son of former Middlesbrough and Manchester City midfielder Jamie Pollock, and younger brother to professional footballer Ben Pollock. ==Statistics== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="3"|League !colspan="2"|FA Cup !colspan="2"|EFL Cup !colspan="2"|Other !colspan="2"|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |rowspan="3"|Grimsby Town |2018–19||EFL League Two||2||0||0||0||0||0||0||0||2||0 |- |2019–20||EFL League Two||13||0||2||0||3||0||3||0||21||0 |- !colspan="2"|Total !15!!0!!2!!0!!3!!0!!3!!0!!23!!0 |- !colspan="3"|Career total !15!!0!!2!!0!!3!!0!!3!!0!!23!!0 |} Other includes appearances in Football League Trophy ==References== Category:2001 births Category:Living people Category:English footballers Category:Association football defenders Category:Leeds United F.C. players Category:Grimsby Town F.C. players Category:English Football League players
